content.description:
Ecce tibi Decius “Quaero,” inquit, “SecundeSecunde = Pliny, quid de Porcio 
sentias.” Vides quod periculum,1 si respondissem “bene”; 
quod flagitiumflagitium, -i, n.: shameful act si “male.”
 1:Supply an understood futurum esset (“would be”).↩
content.question: In the passage, Pliny is concerned about what will happen if he

choices.label: admits to knowing Porcius well enough
gives a positive or negative opinion
trusts too much in the gods

content.answer: gives a positive or negative opinion
